title: How can someone who has started making music get people to listen to it? - Quora

response.answer_text: How do people get anyone to view, listen, purchase or think about their music (product)? The answer is - Marketing Think about everything you love and why you love it! I’ve found that presenting the right questions in these situations, tends to help define the right answers. What type of artist do you want to be? Wait what? Yes, what kind of artist do you want to be? As there are various focuses across every profession, such as doctors, teachers, and engineers, musicians are no different. Deciding which type of musician you want to be, is important to help identify what type of education would be required.Recording ArtistPerforming/Studio ArtistTouring ArtistProducerThere are other great places to read about this..Digital Music News - this gives a great perspective on various forms of DYI musiciansAbout Music Schools - a more direct response, identifying the over arching elements of a MusicianWhat musicians do you love, and have you studied them? If you study your favorite artists, you will notice they are doing quite a bit of marketing. This has always been a great place to do research. If you study an artist you don’t like, your odds of completing a proper competitive analysis, isn’t very high.How did you hear about the records/songs/artists you currently listen to? Marketing is a system, not magic. Unbeknownst to the consumer, they are put into a machine of what they love; a revolving door of someone else’s professional opinion. That’s why you see ads of items you want/need. Unfortunately the reason why you see a shit load of ads you don’t want/need, because someone is betting on your psychological profile to purchase what they have! #adblock they clearly didn’t put enough time into research, or they don’t care…What are you doing to constantly learn and grow? In an industry that is currently seeing more innovation in the last five years than it has in the past 2 decades, it’s imperative to keep up with the industry and study it while it changes.Can you just answer my question!? Yes, the answer is always about your goals.What do you want to achieve with your music in 2018?What do I need to accomplish every month to get there?What do I need to accomplish every week to achieve each month’s goals?What do I need to do daily to achevie my weekly goals?What should I be doing right now!I hoped this helped! Now, if you posted a link to your Youtube channel, we all would have clicked on it and hear you. Social media of all kind. Make sample CD’s and pass them out though, most people get everything digitally nowadays. If you want to be heard live, check out libraries, churches, schools, nursing homes, clubs, bars, public access. Your tax dollars pay for libraries and public access channels and that gives you the right to use them for free. Book a library, advertise it and invite everyone you know.

Believe me, the answer is simpler than most people here write. Call a friend. “Hey, I made some music, check it out and tell me what you think!” Then call another friend, then another. Meet a like-minded person? Share your music. Know a music fan? Share your music. Just share your music. Start small. Marketing can come later. Be comfortable first with actually sharing your music personally. Sharing to the rest of the world will follow.

Share it.
